snippet: Republican leaders increased their efforts to persuade Rep. Paul Ryan of Wisconsin to run for speaker of the House, as they saw him as the only one with the potential to unify the party.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and CARL HULSE

abstract: Republican leaders are working hard to urge Rep Paul Ryan of Wisconsin to run for speaker of the House, asserting that he is only one who can unify fractured party; Ryan appears to be considering position.

keywords.value: House Committee on Ways and Means
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Republican leaders increased their efforts to persuade Rep. Paul Ryan of Wisconsin to run for speaker of the House, as they saw him as the only one with the potential to unify the party.

headline.print_headline: Desperate G.O.P. Appeals to Ryan on Speaker’s Job
headline.main: Desperate G.O.P. Appeals to Ryan on Speaker’s Job
